bibl.title: Structure and Scale in the Roman Economy.
bibl.note: Introduction. - I. Time and Distance. - II. Demography and Manpower. - III. Agrarian Patterns. - IV. The World of Cities. - V. Tax-Payment and Tax-Assessment. - Appendices.
bibl.seg: DUNCAN-JONES Richard, Structure and Scale in the Roman Economy.
Cambridge, Cambridge University Press, 1990, 8°, xvi-245 pp., nombr. tabl. et graph. £35.
Introduction. - I. Time and Distance. - II. Demography and Manpower. - III. Agrarian Patterns. - IV. The World of Cities. - V. Tax-Payment and Tax-Assessment. - Appendices.

C.R. par Henry C. Boren, AJP 114 (1993) pp. 174-177. - Raphaela Czech-Schneider, HZ 257 (1993) pp. 457-458. - Bruce W. Frier, JRA 5 (1992) pp. 286-290. - Alessandra Gara, Athenaeum 80 (1992) pp. 277-280. - Peter Herz, Gnomon 65 (1993) pp. 410-414. - Gabriele Marasco, Prometheus 18 (1992) pp. 94-95. - Phyllis Culham, CW 85 (1991-1992) pp. 745-746. - J.K. Davies, JRS 84 (1994) pp. 231-233. - Jean Andreau, AntCl 65 (1996) pp. 476-478.
